reviews.review_msg: Course: MBB 324 (idk why I can't select or add this course on RMP) Slides are so messy and random. Midterms were fair but still hard. Final exam has 2 parts; both insanely hard. Please never take this guy. GPA definitely took a hit.

He's a nice guy, and he presents content in memorable/engaging ways. He'll ask people for answers in class, but doesn't judge responses. Exams are fair (study the objective lists & reference sheets), but MBB321 is a tough memorization course. I can see how others think his slides are a lot, but tbh my ADHD brain would make them the same way.

Dr Young has been such a pleasure this semester! Teaches with lots of passion and a great sense of humour. Lectures were taught in person and were recorded as well, which made learning so accessible! Lots of opportunities to make up for lost marks, and the timing for exams was extremely fair imo. Tip: review learning objectives for exam prep!

Dr. Young is one of the best MBB profs there are. Teaches material clearly, fair exams, nice marking scheme, reviews topics often to help students. 321 with Dr. Young made it much easier to understand all the pathways because of his teaching style. Would 100% take another course with him

Unnecessarily complicates lectures by going into too much depth. Very messy slides filled with information, and doesn't give enough time for tests. MTs which are supposed to be 50 min are 45 minutes, and he started distributing exams after class starts. Also, some questions are out of the syllabus.

Literally, take any other professor but him.

Truth-not an easy course but def fun to learn. keep up with the lect* it accumulates fast. I studied Obj for exams, I recommend having obj and lect side by side when you study. Exams were fair but get ur timing right(min/q). Dr. Y an awe prof. his teaching was very logical, metaphoric, humorous.

Enthusiastic prof but does not present information in a clear and concise way. As previous readers have suggested, better to self-learn. Did not enjoy this course, material relatively easy as there are lots of resources online. His notes? Not good, crowded, and hard to navigate.

enthusiastic lecturer but holy crap UGLIEST and most cluttered slides ever, makes concepts unnecessarily difficult to understand. better off self-teaching and watching youtube videos tbh. learning objectives somewhat helpful for tests but they are also cluttered and hard to interpret at times.

Lecture slides are disorganized with lots of clutter and every week there is an objective list filled with LOTS of info on what is examinable(also cluttered). Exams are ok, I had ingrid for 222 and wish I took her for 321 instead. Edgar takes feedback though and changed how the canvas was organized but also is adamant on not posting tutorial slides

Was a pleasure having Dr Young teach this course. Made attending morning lectures interesting and he was always very welcoming. The grading system was student friendly, consisting of 6 exams (50 pts each), but total exam grade was only worth 250 points. Also 7 quizzes but only graded best 5. Cumulative final (last 2 exams) were pretty tough

Had quizzes every week and exams when we didn't. 6 exams worth 50 marks each for a total of 300 but only total calculated using 250. 7 quizzes worth 10 marks each for a total of 60 but only calculated using 50. Exams worth 90%, quizzes worth 10%. Hard Cumulative final exam (2 exams with a 30 minute gap)
He is a wonderful prof. Have Iclicker to make students go to the morning class which is good. Keep up with the review sheets.

He is an okay prof, but overhead notes written are messy and hard to read. Sometimes goes on a tangent and often you will have to go over slides that he did not present in class. Tries a bit hard to be funny. Lots of iClicker questions for credit. He gives out review lists that the exams are based on and has a fair grading system.

I thought he is a very nice and funny teacher and genuinely cares about his students doing well. Clickers almost every class for participation, gives out "cheat sheets" to follow along, slides aren't too bad, tests are very fair. Uploads his slides and whatever he writes on the overhead after every class so even if you skip a day you can catch up.
